intro: Hyperthelia macrolepis, commonly known as the broad-leaved thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features robust, spiny stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer. Hyperthelia macrolepis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
